plugins.name: Ripplix - Animation Library
plugins.description:
Ripplix — friction-free design hand-off with motion

Skip the time-consuming prototypes and pin real-world interactions straight onto your Figma file.

Ripplix already has a curated library of 1 500 + micro-interactions from 300 + live apps & sites into an easy-to-search sidebar. One click drops a comment tag on the exact UI element (button, card, tab…) and links to a full-screen preview on ripplix.com so developers instantly see how it should feel—timing, easing, choreography and all.


Why you’ll use it every hand-off

  1. Contextual pins – Each animation is attached as a Figma comment on the layer you select, so engineers don’t have to hunt for it.
  2. Real-app reference – Every clip comes from production UIs, giving devs proven motion patterns instead of speculative mocks.
  3. Search that speaks UX – Filter by platform (Web, iOS, Android, Watch), pattern (hover, dropdown, empty state…), industry or keyword.
  4. One-click preview – Comment contains a “View on Ripplix” link → opens the HD interaction with playback controls, frame counter and downloadable Lottie/CSS snippets.
  5. Zero bloat – Nothing is embedded in the Figma file except a tiny thumbnail + link, so your files stay light.


Typical Workflow

  1. Select a layer that needs motion polish.
  2. In the Ripplix sidebar search “hover + dropdown”.
  3. Preview candidates; click Add to Figma.
  4. A comment tag appears on your layer, click upon you can preview the motion.
  5. During hand-off, devs open the link, watch the real interaction, and build it confident they’re matching the reference.


Need help or want to suggest an animation we’re missing?

📧 support@ripplix.com


Install Ripplix → pin a motion reference → ship delightful, on-brand interactions—without another endless prototype.
plugins.tagline: Inspiring for better Interaction

plugins.name: Unit Converter Pro - Measurement Calculator for Figma
plugins.description:
Unit Converter Pro - The Ultimate Measurement Calculator for Figma

Transform your design workflow with the most comprehensive unit conversion tool available for Figma. Unit Converter Pro instantly converts between any measurement units across 8 different categories, saving you valuable design time.

Features:

• Convert between ALL common design units: pixels, inches, cm, points, and more

• Support for 8 conversion categories: Length, Area, Volume, Weight, Temperature, Time, Speed, and Data

• Real-time conversion as you type - see results instantly

• Clean, intuitive interface that matches Figma's design language

• Works directly within your Figma workspace - no need to switch between apps

Perfect for:

• UI/UX designers working across different measurement systems

• Design teams collaborating internationally

• Creating responsive designs that require precise unit conversions

• Print and digital designers who need to convert between physical and digital units

• Anyone who wants to save time on manual calculations

Stop wasting time with manual calculations or switching between apps. Unit Converter Pro handles all your measurement conversion needs in one place, letting you focus on what matters most - your designs.

Convert any unit with just a few clicks and design with confidence!

plugins.name: HubSpot Developers: UI Extensions Auto Card Builder
plugins.description:
Welcome to the HubSpot Developers Figma Plugin for our UI Extensions Figma Design Kit

This plugin is brought to you by HubSpot DevRel Labs, an initiative to create solutions for developers to thrive while building with HubSpot.


Requirements: HubSpot UI Extensions Figma Design Kit


Create amazing HubSpot UI Extensions designs in minutes. Do you need to prototype a UI Extension quickly for your clients? Well, now you can with the HubSpot UI Extensions Figma plugin. Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.


Upcoming Features

  1. Add pre-defined use-cases to choose from that will auto-populate the card with the appropriate components.
  2. Add a way to auto-generate the UI Extension code from the components you choose.


Please leave any and all feedback for this plugin on our Feedback form. Please specify that you're sharing feedback for our Figma UI Extension Builder plugin.

---------------

Made with 🧡 by the HubSpot DevRel Team.

Learn more about UI Extensions on our developer documentation site.

HubSpot UI Extensions are currently in beta and subject to the Early Adopter Program terms. Read the terms.

plugins.name: Text Paster
plugins.description:
What it does

This plugin allows you to:

  1. Select text layers from a selection
  2. Copy text strings from multiple text layers
  3. Paste text strings into multiple text layers in batch
  4. Sort text strings


How to use it

Transfer texts between frame

  1. Select a frame that contain text layers
  2. Click Copy in the plugin
  3. Select another frame that contain text layers you want to transfer the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Transfer text from Spreadsheet

  1. Copy text from a spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.) or any line-break-separated text.
  2. Paste it into the text box in plugin
  3. Select a frame that contain text layers you want to paste the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Delete hidden layers

  1. Select a frame
  2. Click Select "Hidden layer" (from dropdown menu)
  3. Press Delete key to delete hidden layers


-------

Kudos to AI — This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
plugins.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

plugins.name: TDS - Persian Component Configuration Mapping
plugins.description:
Persian Converter for Alt Names

Effortlessly create component mapping for bilingual designers text in components with Persian support!


What it does

This plugin automatically converts Component configurations following "Alt. name:" lines to Persian script while preserving your original content. Perfect for designers working with multilingual interfaces or Persian localization.


Key Features


Smart Conversion

Transliterates English letters → Persian script using Persian-Standard keyboard mappings.

Converts digits → Persian numerals (۰۱۲۳)

Preserves non-Persian symbols/punctuation


Clean Workflow

  1. Purge Existing Persian - Removes all prior Persian characters/numbers from "Alt. name:" lines
  2. Convert - Transforms English characters to Persian equivalents
  3. Append - Adds converted text below original with proper spacing


Ideal For

Persian interface localization

Bilingual design systems

Teams collaborating across Latin/Persian script workflows

Maintaining clean alt-text alternatives in components

Design System Managers


Why Design System Managers will Love It:

No manual copy-pasting between lines

Prevents script mixing errors

Case-insensitive matching ("ALT. NAME:", "alt name :", etc.)

Multi-Format Support (Plain text nodes, Markdown-enabled descriptions)


-----


Coded with AI and ZERO coding knowledge :)
plugins.tagline: Maps component configuration from english keyboard to Standart persian keyboard

plugins.name: Codex — Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary — just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you’re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don’t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: Schemator
plugins.description:
Schemator provides a flexible schema for your components helping you build code connect and write further tooling on it.


  1. Consistent Naming - Establish a universal schema for component properties, promoting seamless collaboration and code integration across teams and projects.
  2. Predictable Structure - Adopt a familiar and logical naming convention, ensuring that components are intuitive to use and easy to extend.
  3. Sanitized Definitions - Enable customization by adding suffixes and prefixes to property definitions, giving developers the flexibility to tailor components to their specific workflows.


Schemator is full open sourced, feel free to make changes to the rules and logic as you like 😀

plugins.description:
Showcase makes presenting specific frames to your team effortless. Whether you’re walking through a design or highlighting a particular frame, Showcase lets you do so directly within the canvas, offering smooth flyover animations for a seamless presentation. Independent of the zoom level, you have full control over how close or far you view your frames—adjust zoom as desired.


Showcase is also helpful when working with large files that contain many frames. If you ever feel lost in the canvas, Showcase helps you quickly focus on a specific frame by simply selecting it from the layers panel.


Showcase is free to use. If you find it helpful, consider supporting the project by buying me a coffee ☕️.

accepted.name: Saleh KAYYALI
accepted.description: Hey 👋🏼  I'm an interaction designer with a passion for nifty productivity tools.

plugins.tagline: Present your Figma frames effortlessly.

plugins.name: Figma Frame History
plugins.description:
This tool enables version-controlled frame history management directly on the page. It offers four key commands:


• Major Version: Select a BASE NODE on the page and execute this command. A NEW NODE will be created right after the BASE NODE, with a version control suffix in its name (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v2.0).


• Minor Version: Similar to the **Major Version** command, but only the minor version number is incremented by 1 (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v1.1).


• Unlock History: This command unlocks all previously locked frames in the history, restoring them to their default style.


• Lock History: This command locks all history frames again, making them transparent.


If the BASE NODE name does not include a version control suffix _${majorVersion}.${minorVersion}, the NEW NODE name will default to ${baseNodeName}_v1.0 when either the Major Version or Minor Version command is executed.

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: A frame history management tool for creating and organizing frame versions directly on the page

plugins.name: tokenXtractor - by techworks studio
plugins.description:
tokenXtractor is a Figma plugin thoughtfully crafted to make exporting local variables, or tokens, easy and accessible. Its usage is fairly straightforward: configure your options, select your collections, and then download them.


1) Configure your options


  1. Case Style
  2. Export Single File
  3. Export Format


2) Select your collections


All collections are selected by default, so if you would like to export all your collections, you can skip this step. Otherwise, click on the variable collection name to select / deselect it for export.You can select multiple using CMD + Click (MacOS) or CTRL + Click (Windows). To select a range, click the first collection and then SHIFT + Click the last collection.You can undo your selection by clicking the 'RESET' button next to 'Collections?'


3) Download your tokens


Finally, press the 'DOWNLOAD TOKENS' button, save the zip file where you'd like, and then unzip the file to access your exported tokens.


Previewing + Misc. Tips


The right half of the plugin contains a 'preview' of the tokens to be exported. When exporting multiple files, you can use the dropdown menu next to 'Previewing' to switch the collection you're viewing.


------------------------------

Brought to you by techworks.studio

------------------------------
plugins.tagline: Export local variables to code-ready files

plugins.name: Avctoris Copyright
plugins.description:
The Avctoris Copyright plugin for Figma is a comprehensive tool designed to help creators protect and manage their intellectual property rights effortlessly. With this plugin, users can seamlessly generate a PDF certificate of their design work directly from their Figma workspace, ensuring that their creations are legally safeguarded.


Key Features:


Automated PDF Generation: Export your design assets into a PDF format for easy documentation and protection.

Intellectual Property Management: Record detailed information about the authors and holders of rights for each creation.

Secure Registration: Easily submit your work for copyright registration and receive a certificate, ensuring your designs are legally protected.

User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive UI integrated into Figma, allowing for a smooth and seamless experience.

Real-Time Collaboration: Continue collaborating on designs while managing copyrights without leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Where Ideas Come to Life

plugins.name: Unidup
plugins.description:
Create a design set template that includes component usage and color schemes. With this plugin, you can duplicate your template to a new page, automatically apply new instances of the original component's new variants under consistent layers, and create brand new color schemes.


Additionally, color schemes can be exported in JSON format.



Document Preparation


Document Structure: Prepare the design drafts of the design scheme, which should include "Components Page" and "Template Page", as well as "Color Scheme".


Naming: Each reuse of the design scheme should have a unique name, let's tentatively call it "NAME". This naming is very important as it runs through the entire reuse process.


Template Page: The "Template Page" is the page of your design scheme, and its name should be called NAME. It will play a big role in subsequent work, transforming into various new outputs and serving various new purposes. Therefore, each artboard should contain instances of components for reuse.


Components Page: Each time the design scheme is reused, the output should be unique. The "Components Page" contains unique elements in each set of outputs, and each component should include variants, with the key of the variant being "name" and the value being NAME, to correspond with each set of outputs.


Color Scheme: The naming method for local color schemes in figma is xxx/xxx. When naming, please follow the structure NAME/color1, NAME/color2.



How to Use


Duplicate and Export JSON are two main functions.


Duplicate:

There are three cards in the interface, namely "Components Page", "From Template", and "New Page Naming".


  1. Select your "Components Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "Components Page", and the card will display the details of the "Components Page".
  2. Select your "Template Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "From template", and the card will display the details of the "Template Page".
  3. In the "New Page Naming" card, name your new output.
  4. Click the "Duplicate" button, and you have extended a new output from the "Template Page". Modify the associated components and color scheme, and this output is ready.



Export JSON:

It will list the NAME of all your output schemes, click to export the rgba color values, and download the json to your local.




See usage demo file:

https://www.figma.com/file/jUg3U53QSIzWBEn0RfUdB0/
plugins.tagline: Unidup - An easy way to reuse your design set

plugins.name: Auto Palette
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for formula-driven, dynamic color extraction.


Auto Palette is a plugin that helps designers extract smart, context-aware color palettes directly from images using precise formulas — including average, dominant, and contrast-aware color models.


In a time when Material 3 is embracing expressive tones and iOS 19 leaks tease a UI shift toward progressive blur and dynamic visuals, Auto Palette gives you a reliable starting point to build your own adaptive, fluid color systems.


Coming soon:


Color variable mapping for component-level handoff

Design token export to streamline dev collaboration

Design with clarity. Build with logic. Hand off with confidence.

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
131205.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


🔶 Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ⤴️ Select Instance

- ✅ Instance Mode On

- 🚫 Instance Mode Off


⤴️ Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


✅ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `⤴️ Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


🚫 Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


🔶 How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->⤴️ Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->✅ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->🚫 Instance Mode Off

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: Selecting parent/ancestor instances automatically

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! 🚀


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly — no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens — including colors and fonts — and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesn’t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment — perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper — manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans — free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

That’s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.


Tutorials

https://www.loom.com/share/3d743648bd3643e5a50b7dff7d54bbf2

https://www.loom.com/share/b3a6f11e12734fe18da5d30106fe4c54

https://www.loom.com/share/0ec7731eb20f404d9259222377f40cef
plugins.tagline: Swaps font, color and space tokens of components imported from other libraries.
